name: World Nuclear Council
goal: As Institution, WONUC activities are oriented and centralized in the defense of the rights of professionals and employees of the nuclear related industry and science, in Europe and all over the World:( n)- Promoting the European Principals and Objectives in these domains; ( n)- Promoting the European Industry of peaceful applications of nuclear energy, as well as the related non-proliferating technologies;( n)- Generating and development relations between organizations and institutions, academia and civil society, representing the interests of professionals and employees of the nuclear related science and industry;( n)( n)Organizing and participating in most of nuclear related projects, events and debates contributing to:( n)- The construction of the image of nuclear energy and its public acceptance;( n)- The improvement of the knowledge with respect to public acceptance about nuclear energy and its peaceful applications; and( n)- The enhancement of scientiﬁc and technical knowledge on the peaceful applications of nuclear energy.( n)( n)Considering the peaceful applications of nuclear energy in the problematic of sustainable economic, ecological and social developments.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Business and Industry, Climate Action, Communication, Culture, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Enlargement, Environment, External Relations, Food Safety, Foreign affairs and security policy, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Institutional affairs, International co-operation and development, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Trans-European Networks, Youth
euInitiatives: WONUC's Main Objectives are the Promotion and Defense of the Fundamental Values of the European Union. The respect for equality between women and men; the promotion of the education, as an engine of economic and social growth; the promotion and dissemination and of the basic concepts for the peaceful applications of the nuclear energy; the contribution to the ediﬁcation and defence of the environment rules and regulations; the immediate decrease of greenhouse gas emissions, the tutelage and promotion of desalination of ocean water, the publicity and development of ionic castration techniques of predatory insects, to limit the use of pesticides; the easy supply of energy, at low prices, for all people; and the therapeutic use of atomic energy sources, to alleviate sufferance and improve people’s health.
